poem:
The Cost of Ignorance  

In the ledger of the land,  
numbers blur the cries—  
invisible ink on human skin.  
Keir counts the coins stacked  
on bodies, young and idle,  
not learning life's worth.  
They slip through cracks,  
unheld by hands  
that balance only books,  
not souls,  
in this economy of neglect.
